intro: Corispermum × czernjaevii, commonly known as the hybrid bladderwilt, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its most distinctive feature is the inflated, bladder-like seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Corispermum × czernjaevii is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
